alert.note: Alert for Chelan; Ferry; Okanogan; Pend Oreille; Stevens (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 06 at 6:10AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner, Boundary and Shoshone. Portions of Washington, including the following counties, Chelan, Ferry, Okanogan, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...From 10 AM PDT this morning through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other flood-prone locations, especially burn scars. Some of the burned areas included in the Flash Flood Watch are the Russell Mountain, Ford Corkscrew, Walker Creek, Muckamuck, Cub Creek, Cedar Creek, 25 Mile, Red Apple, and Eagle Bluff burn scars * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Atmospheric conditions will favor slow moving thunderstorms capable of locally heavy rain Sunday and Monday. Steep terrain and burned areas of north central, northeast Washington, and northern Idaho will be particularly vulnerable to flash flooding. Runoff and excessive rain will be capable of producing rock and mud slides as well as debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Chelan; Ferry; Okanogan; Pend Oreille; Stevens
